text: One of my favorite games ever is finally getting its console release tomorrow (also on Game Pass if you have it). I loved this game right from the start, but it's when I reached the Temple Mine and I heard this theme that I knew this was a gem. It's a perfect mix of Zelda, MMO and action-RPG. Don't miss out on this.
author: SupraDarky

text: Yooooooo the switch version is finally out? I've been waiting for this

text: This game is very underrated.  It's a kickstarter game that did everything that it was supposed to.  It was actually a great game and had a great soundtrack.  It's also super polished.  PLAY IT.

author: SupraDarky

text: I absolutely loved this game.  I feel like it was woefully overlooked.  The music was also very iconic--perfectly captured the tone of the 16-bit era of sci-fantasy RPGs.
author: blue_tetris

text: Probably that's the reason why. It looks painfully generic at a first glance. The market is just saturated with many pixel art RPGs/games in general that often the good ones get overlooked
author: Gu the Tanuki

text: Those screams... aren't they from Final Fantasy Tactics?
author: Sephiko

text: The whole OST sounded similar to the soundfont from FF6 and Tactics.
author: blue_tetris

text: Some Chrono Trigger samples in other tracks too.
author: jb1980ist

text: ​@jb1980ist Along with samples from things like Chrono Cross, Phantasy Star... this composer's really preying on nostalgia.
author: Sephiko

text:
@Sephiko There are at least two songs that are almost straight Chrono Cross, yeah. The Bergen Trail theme for one, and the music that plays in the electric dungeon has almost the same beat and background as Chronopolis.
But I'm not complaining! They're still excellent songs!
author: Sam Smith
